intro: Sceletium exalatum, commonly known as kanna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its unique chemical composition includes compounds like kanna alkaloids, which contribute to its traditional use as a mild stimulant and sedative. Sceletium exalatum has been historically used by indigenous communities for its psychoactive and medicinal properties.
